snippet: In a high-seas operation mixing diplomacy, drama and Middle Eastern politics, American sailors boarded the mother ship of Somali pirates and freed 13 Iranian hostages who had been captive since November.
abstract: United States sailors free 13 Iranian hostages from cargo ship that had been captured by Somali pirates and converted into a base of operations in the Gulf of Oman; 15 pirates are captured; mission is conducted from the aircraft carrier John C Stennis, which Iranian military officials had bluntly warned not to re-enter the gulf; rescuers are welcomed joyfully by hostages, who had been held captive by the pirates since November 2011.
lead_paragraph: In a high-seas operation mixing diplomacy, drama and Middle Eastern politics, American sailors boarded the mother ship of Somali pirates and freed 13 Iranian hostages who had been captive since November.

headline.seo: For Iranians Held by Pirates, U.S. to the Rescue
headline.main: For Iranians Waylaid by Pirates, U.S. to the Rescue
headline.print_headline: For Iranians Held by Pirates, U.S. to the Rescue
